name: ray.data.read_api.read_lance
signature: ray.data.read_api.read_lance(uri: str, *, columns: Optional[List[str]] = None, filter: Optional[str] = None, storage_options: Optional[Dict[str, str]] = None, scanner_options: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None, ray_remote_args: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None, concurrency: Optional[int] = None, override_num_blocks: Optional[int] = None) -> ray.data.dataset.Dataset

args.name: uri
args.desc:
The URI of the Lance dataset to read from. Local file paths, S3, and GCS
are supported.

args.name: columns
args.desc: The columns to read. By default, all columns are read.

args.name: filter
args.desc:
Read returns only the rows matching the filter. By default, no
filter is applied.

args.name: storage_options
args.desc:
Extra options that make sense for a particular storage
connection. This is used to store connection parameters like credentials,
endpoint, etc. For more information, see `Object Store Configuration <https                ://lancedb.github.io/lance/read_and_write.html#object-store-configuration>`_.

args.name: scanner_options
args.desc:
Additional options to configure the `LanceDataset.scanner()`
method, such as `batch_size`. For more information,
see `LanceDB API doc <https://lancedb.github.io            /lance/api/python/lance.html#lance.dataset.LanceDataset.scanner>`_

args.name: ray_remote_args
args.desc: kwargs passed to :meth:`~ray.remote` in the read tasks.

args.name: concurrency
args.desc:
The maximum number of Ray tasks to run concurrently. Set this
to control number of tasks to run concurrently. This doesn't change the
total number of tasks run or the total number of output blocks. By default,
concurrency is dynamically decided based on the available resources.

args.name: override_num_blocks
args.desc:
Override the number of output blocks from all read tasks.
By default, the number of output blocks is dynamically decided based on
input data size and available resources. You shouldn't manually set this
value in most cases.

returns: A :class:`~ray.data.Dataset` producing records read from the Lance dataset.

examples.code:
>>> import ray
>>> ds = ray.data.read_lance( # doctest: +SKIP
...     uri="./db_name.lance",
...     columns=["image", "label"],
...     filter="label = 2 AND text IS NOT NULL",
... )
